questions.question: What is the time complexity of binary search in a sorted array?
Which data structure uses FIFO (First In, First Out) principle?
What does CPU stand for?
Which of the following is not an operating system?
In C programming, which symbol is used to indicate a comment?
Which of the following is a programming language?
What is the main function of the ALU in a computer?
Which protocol is used to send email?
Which of the following is an example of an input device?
What is the output of 2 + 2 in most programming languages?
Which algorithm is used to find the shortest path in a graph?
In a relational database, what does SQL stand for?
What is the purpose of a foreign key in a database?
What is the time complexity of merge sort?
What does API stand for?
Which data structure is best for implementing a LIFO (Last In, First Out) order?
What is a linked list?
options: A data structure where elements point to the next element
questions.answer: A data structure where elements point to the next element

questions.question: Which of the following is not a type of database management system?
What is the primary use of a hash table?
What is the main advantage of using a database index?
What is the Big-O notation for the best-case performance of the QuickSort algorithm?
Which of the following is a key characteristic of a NoSQL database?
In the context of operating systems, what is a 'race condition'?
options: A situation where two processes wait for each other
A scenario where two processes access shared data simultaneously
A condition where a process runs faster than others
A situation where the CPU runs out of resources
questions.answer: A scenario where two processes access shared data simultaneously

questions.question: What is the purpose of the ACID properties in database management?
What is the primary difference between a process and a thread?
options: Processes share memory, threads do not
Threads share memory, processes do not
Threads can run on multiple CPUs, processes cannot
questions.answer: Threads share memory, processes do not

questions.question: What is the role of a hypervisor in virtualization?
options: To control the hardware resources for virtual machines
To provide security for virtual machines
questions.answer: To control the hardware resources for virtual machines

questions.question: Which of the following algorithms is used to detect deadlocks in an operating system?
What is the main purpose of a load balancer in a distributed system?
What does the CAP theorem state in distributed systems?
options: A system can achieve consistency, availability, and partition tolerance simultaneously
A system can achieve only two out of consistency, availability, and partition tolerance
A system can only achieve consistency and availability
A system can only achieve availability and partition tolerance
questions.answer: A system can achieve only two out of consistency, availability, and partition tolerance

questions.question: Which of the following is an NP-complete problem?
options: Finding the shortest path in a graph
